contextId.information: By saying he will return to the people of Israel, Yahweh is saying that they will have good things happen because he is helping them. AT: "I will bless you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The woman represents wickedness. AT: "Her name is Wickedness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
AT: Then use the silver and the gold to make a crown. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Then take the silver and gold, make a crown

contextId.information: This refers to the Israelites who remain in Babylon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This phrase refers to when they ate and drank at feasts to honor how Yahweh had provided for them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

These refer to meat with blood in it, and to meat offered to idols. The UDB makes this explicit. AT: "I will no longer allow them to eat meat that still has blood in it, and I will forbid them to eat food that they offered to idols" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I will remove their blood from their mouths and their abominations from between their teeth
